summary: This bill proposes across-the-board rescissions of nonsecurity discretionary spending for fiscal years 2026 and beyond. For fiscal year 2026, 1% of nonsecurity discretionary appropriations will be rescinded. For fiscal year 2027, the rescission rate is 2%, increasing to 5% for subsequent fiscal years. The Office of Management and Budget is required to report the specific rescissions to the Appropriations Committees of the Senate and House of Representatives. The bill aims to reduce government spending.
